title: Moral Philosophy
synopsis: [[Ethics]] or moral philosophy is a branch of philosophy that involves systematizing, defending, and recommending concepts of right and wrong conduct. The term ethics derives from the Ancient Greek word ἠθικός ethikos, which is derived from the word ἦθος ethos (habit, "custom"). The branch of philosophy axiology comprises the sub-branches of ethics and aesthetics, each concerned with values - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethics wikipedia]

title: Morality
synopsis: Morality (from the Latin moralitas "manner, character, proper behavior") is the differentiation of intentions, decisions, and actions between those that are distinguished as proper and those that are improper - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morality wikipedia]
